No one has rights to merge without CI passing, and CI is completely stuck for the whole repository.  I don't believe anyone other than you has the rights necessary to *fix* the broken CI (it is probably an invalidated oath key for Travis or something).

author: lightclient
content:
I opened a PR on the EIPs repo to transition the site from Jekyll to Zola: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2890
It would be great if some people could weigh in. I think that removing all the ruby from our CI pipeline will significantly improve our confidence in builds and deployments. The new `toml` front matter format will also be much better to work with in `eipv` and the mergebot.
